results.title: A Cancer Trial’s Unexpected Result: Remission in Every Patient
results.abstract: The study was small, and experts say it needs to be replicated. But for 18 people with rectal cancer, the outcome led to “happy tears.”

media.caption: Sascha Roth, the first patient in the trial, unexpectedly learned she had rectal cancer in 2018. Her gastroenterologist, she recalled, told her during a sigmoidoscopy, “Oh no. I was notexpecting this!”

results.title: Mongols Motorcycle Club Says Its Leader Was an Informant
results.abstract: The biker group hopes to set aside a $500,000 racketeering conviction, alleging that its former president cooperated with the government during a trial.
org_facet: Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives

media.caption: David Santillan, the president of the Mongols, was ousted by the group after a video surfaced that implied he was being protected by a federal agent.

results.title: U.S. Warship Arrives in Stockholm for Military Exercises, and as a Warning
results.abstract: For Sweden and Finland, which want to join NATO, the U.S.S. Kearsarge is a promise of the protection that membership in the alliance would bring against President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia.

media.caption: Watching the U.S.S. Kearsarge arrive in Stockholm on Thursday.

results.title: Dozens Killed and Hundreds Burned in Bangladesh Depot Disaster
results.abstract: A fire set off a series of explosions, killing at least 49 people, including firefighters. Many others were in critical condition.

media.caption: Firefighters on Sunday were still trying to contain a blaze that began late Saturday night at a container depot in Sitakunda, Bangladesh.

results.title: Rafael Nadal, Looking Unbeatable, Wins 14th French Open Title
results.abstract: Nadal extended his men’s singles record of 22 Grand Slam tournament titles with a win in straight sets over the eighth-seeded Casper Ruud.

media.caption: Rafael Nadal beat Casper Ruud in straight sets in the final.
media.copyright: Pete Kiehart for The New York Times

results.title: As Battles Rage, Ukraine Rejects Macron Plea Not to ‘Humiliate’ Russia
results.abstract: Amid reports of battlefield gains by Ukraine, an official angrily rejected Mr. Macron’s advice, saying it “can only humiliate France.”

media.caption: Ukrainian soldiers at a frontline position near Donetsk in eastern Ukraine on Saturday.

results.adx_keywords: School Shootings and Armed Attacks;Gun Control;Mass Shootings;Law and Legislation;Suicides and Suicide Attempts;United States Politics and Government;Suffolk County (NY)
results.byline: By Andy Newman, Benjamin Weiser and Ashley Southall
results.title: How a New York County Used the State’s ‘Red Flag’ Law to Seize 160 Guns
results.abstract: Suffolk County on Long Island aggressively uses the law to take guns from people in crisis in an effort to prevent shootings and suicides. Its experience could inform a national debate.

media.caption: The massacre at a Buffalo supermarket raised questions about why the suspect had not been subject to a red flag order. Such orders are most widely used in New York in Suffolk County.

results.adx_keywords: Real Estate and Housing (Residential);United States Economy
results.title: Twilight of the NIMBY
results.abstract: Suburban homeowners like Susan Kirsch are often blamed for worsening the nation’s housing crisis. That doesn’t mean she’s giving up her two-decade fight against 20 condos.

media.caption: Susan Kirsch in her backyard, just a few hundred feet from the site where Phil Richardson hopes to build a multi-unit housing development.
media.copyright: Aaron Wojack for The New York Times

results.title: Dispatcher Fired Over Mishandling 911 Call During Buffalo Shooting
results.abstract: A Tops supermarket office manager said a dispatcher yelled at her for whispering, as she hid during the shooting, and hung up on her.

media.caption: The executive in Erie County, N.Y., said the way an emergency dispatcher handled a 911 call last month about the Tops supermarket shooting in Buffalo was “completely unacceptable.”
media.copyright: Malik Rainey for The New York Times
